pr_title: [CALCITE-4251] Get the origin column, even if it is derived (xzh)

timeline.bodyText: If derived == null, we would get an NPE here.
timeline.author: liyafan82

replies.bodyText:
If derived == null, we would get an NPE here.

Thanks, update the code.
replies.author: xy2953396112

timeline.bodyText:
I think what you mean is
"
Determines the origin of a column, allow users to choose whether to include the derived column."
timeline.author: yanlin-Lynn

timeline.bodyText: Instead of overload the methods, why not return the origin directly, no matter if it is derived.
timeline.author: danny0405

replies.bodyText: you are right. return the origin directly.
replies.author: xy2953396112

timeline.message: [CALCITE-4251] Get the origin column, even if it is derived (xzh)

timeline.author: yanlin-Lynn

timeline.bodyText: The doc here does not match with the code.
timeline.author: yanlin-Lynn
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -338,25 +338,24 @@ public Double getPercentageOriginalRows(RelNode rel) {
   }
 
   /**
-   * Determines the origin of a column, provided the column maps to a single
-   * column that isn't derived.
+   * Determines the origin of a column, provided the column maps to a origin
+   * column.
    *
    * @see #getColumnOrigins(org.apache.calcite.rel.RelNode, int)
    *
    * @param rel the RelNode of the column
    * @param column the offset of the column whose origin we are trying to
    * determine
    *
-   * @return the origin of a column provided it's a simple column; otherwise,
-   * returns null
+   * @return the origin of a column provided it's a simple column;

replies.bodyText: Thanks for review, update the doc.
replies.author: xy2953396112

timeline.message: [CALCITE-4251] Get the origin column, even if it is derived (xzh)

timeline.bodyText: The code that uses this method should also be tweaked, such as the LoptMultiJoin.

replies.bodyText: Thanks, Please review the code again.
